pt.ua.dicoogle.sdk

Interface DicooglePlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.xeoh.plugins.base.Plugin
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IndexerInterface, JettyPluginInterface, QueryDimInterface, QueryInterface, StorageInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultFileStoragePlugin

    public interface DicooglePlugin
extends net.xeoh.plugins.base.Plugin
    Class interface representing a generic plugin.

    These plugins can have an initialization process, and can be enabled or disabled by the system. Furthermore, every plugin must have a name, so that Dicoogle can address it and control it. No further assumptions are made here regarding functionality. Any other more specific functionality must be defined as a class inheriting from this one.

    Author:
    Frederico Valente, Luís A. Bastião Silva

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Obtains the unique name of plugin. A plugin must have a name to serve as an ID, and this is the method from where it is retrieved. This name must never change.
        Returns:
        the name of the plugin

      • enable

        boolean enable()
        Issues the plugin to become enabled. It is expected that an enabled plugin, once configured, is ready to perform its main tasks.
        Returns:
        whether the plugin was successfully enabled

      • disable

        boolean disable()
        Issues the plugin to become disabled. When called, the plugin is responsible for stopping all services that the plugin is running.
        Returns:
        whether the plugin was successfully disabled

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Verifies if the plugin is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether the plugin is enabled

      • setSettings

        void setSettings(ConfigurationHolder settings)
        Sets the settings of this plugin. This method lets the plugin receive its settings from the core Dicoogle system.
        Parameters:
        settings - the parameters that will be used by the plugin

      • getSettings

        ConfigurationHolder getSettings()
        Obtains access to the settings of the plugin.
        Returns:
        the plugin's settings
